intro: Otostegia sinaitica, commonly known as Sinai stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the rocky habitats of the Sinai Peninsula. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically blooming in spring. Its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in poor soil make it a hardy, low-maintenance species. Otostegia sinaitica is often used in xeriscaping due to its resilience and ornamental appeal.
